title: Rotate Image
description: You are given an n x n 2D image matrix representing the pixels of an image. Flip the image vertically, and then rotate it 90 degrees clockwise. You need to do this in place without using any extra space.
input_format: An n x n 2D array, where 1 <= n <= 20.
output_format: The same 2D array, modified to represent the rotated image.

examples.explanation: The given image is rotated 90 degrees clockwise.
The given image is rotated 90 degrees clockwise.

hints: First, transpose the matrix, then reverse each row.

title: Spiral Matrix
description: Given an m x n matrix, return all elements of the matrix in spiral order. The matrix can be of any size, and you should navigate through the matrix starting from the top left corner, moving right until you reach the end of the row, then moving down the last column, moving left across the last row, and finally moving up the first column, repeating the process until all elements have been traversed.
input_format: A 2D list of integers representing the matrix, where each row has the same number of columns.
output_format: A list of integers representing the elements of the matrix in spiral order.

examples.explanation: The spiral order of the matrix is: start at 1, go right to 3, then down to 6, then left to 4, and finally down to 5.
The spiral order for this 2x2 matrix is simply: 1, 2, 4, 3.

hints: Use four pointers to maintain the boundaries of the current layer.
Iterate while the boundaries are valid.
